intro: Sibara palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's sibara, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Sibara palmeri is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the desert flora in its native range.
